meanings.definition: The belief or attitude that one should not be involved in politics.
meanings.sent1: Her apoliticism was evident when she refused to discuss any political topics.
meanings.sent2: His apoliticism often led to misunderstandings with his politically active friends.
meanings.sent3: At family gatherings, her apoliticism became a running joke as she always changed the subject when politics came up.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of political debates, his apoliticism stood out like a beacon of neutrality.
meanings.sent5: The apoliticism of the group made decision-making difficult during election season.

meanings.definition: The state of being neutral or indifferent towards political matters.
meanings.sent1: The apoliticism of the organization allowed it to work with members from all political parties.
meanings.sent2: Growing up in a household of apoliticism, she never felt the urge to engage in political discussions.
meanings.sent3: His apoliticism was so extreme that he didn't even know who the current president was.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of political turmoil, her apoliticism was like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The apoliticism of the town made it a peaceful place to live, free from political tensions.
